data.title: Tennis scoring
data.statement:
Given the scores for each tennis game, count how many points each player has.
The first player that gets to 4 points wins the game unless there is a tie, which will be discussed later. Points 1,2 and 3 are displayed as <<15>>, <<30>> and <<40>> respectively. When point 4 is reached, the score is displayed as <<game>>. The server's score is always displayed first, so 40-15 means the server is at 40, and the returner is at 15.
When both players are tied at 3 points, the score is displayed as <<deuce>>. The first player to get ahead by 2 points will win the game. If the server wins a point after <<deuce>>, the score would be <<ad-in>>. If it is the returner who wins the point, the score would be <<ad-out>>. The score goes back to <<deuce>> if the server loses a point at <<ad-in>>, or if the returner loses a point at <<ad-out>>.

Summary:

0 => 15 => 30 => 40 => game
 
or 

0 => 15 => 30 => 40 => deuce <=> ad-in / ad-out => game

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read score:word(20)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
Line 1: integer [[n]] for the number of points played
Next [[n]] lines: current score of the game. It is either <<0>>, <<15>>,<<30>> or <<40>> separated by a dash, or a text value of <<game>>, <<deuce>>, <<ad-in>> or <<ad-out>>
data.outputDescription: The final points for each player, separated by a dash

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given the scores for each tennis game, count how many points each player has.
The first player that gets to 4 points wins the game unless there is a tie, which will be discussed later. Points 1,2 and 3 are displayed as 15, 30 and 40 respectively. When point 4 is reached, the score is displayed as game. The server's score is always displayed first, so 40-15 means the server is at 40, and the returner is at 15.
When both players are tied at 3 points, the score is displayed as deuce. The first player to get ahead by 2 points will win the game. If the server wins a point after deuce, the score would be ad-in. If it is the returner who wins the point, the score would be ad-out. The score goes back to deuce if the server loses a point at ad-in, or if the returner loses a point at ad-out.

Summary:

0 => 15 => 30 => 40 => game

or

0 => 15 => 30 => 40 => deuce <=> ad-in / ad-out => game
Input
Line 1: integer n for the number of points played
Next n lines: current score of the game. It is either 0, 15,30 or 40 separated by a dash, or a text value of game, deuce, ad-in or ad-out
Output
The final points for each player, separated by a dash
Constraints
4 <= n < 1000
Example
Input
4
15-0
30-0
40-0
game
Output
4-0
